Token.Abstract: A library of helpful additions to the NSString class to simplify common tasks within Appacitive-iOS-SDK

Returns a resource path from a dictionary of query parameters URL encoded and appended This is a convenience method for constructing a new resource path that includes a query. For example, when given a resourcePath of /contacts and a dictionary of parameters containing foo=bar and color=red, will return /contacts?foo=bar&amp;color=red

Parameter.Name: queryParameters
Parameter.Abstract: A dictionary of query parameters to be URL encoded and appended to the resource path

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new resource path with the query parameters appended

Token.Abstract: Returns a dictionary of parameter keys and values using UTF-8 encoding given a URL-style query string on the receiving object. For example, when given the string /contacts?foo=bar&amp;color=red, this will return a dictionary of parameters containing foo=bar and color=red, excluding the path "/contacts?"

Parameter.Name: receiver
Parameter.Abstract: A string in the form of @"/object/?sortBy=name", or @"/object/?sortBy=name&amp;color=red"

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new dictionary of query parameters, with keys like 'sortBy' and values like 'name'.

Token.Abstract: Returns a dictionary of parameter keys and values given a URL-style query string on the receiving object. For example, when given the string /contacts?foo=bar&amp;color=red, this will return a dictionary of parameters containing foo=bar and color=red, excludes the path "/contacts?"

Parameter.Name: receiver
Parameter.Abstract: A string in the form of @"/object/?sortBy=name", or @"/object/?sortBy=name&amp;color=red"

Parameter.Name: encoding
Parameter.Abstract: The encoding for to use while parsing the query string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new dictionary of query parameters, with keys like 'sortBy' and values like 'name'.

Token.Abstract: Returns a dictionary of parameter keys and values arrays (if requested) given a URL-style query string on the receiving object. For example, when given the string /contacts?foo=bar&amp;color=red, this will return a dictionary of parameters containing foo=[bar] and color=[red], excludes the path "/contacts?"

Parameter.Name: shouldUseArrays
Parameter.Abstract: If NO, it yields the same results as queryParametersUsingEncoding:, otherwise it creates value arrays instead of value strings.

Parameter.Name: encoding
Parameter.Abstract: The encoding for to use while parsing the query string.

Parameter.Name: receiver
Parameter.Abstract: A string in the form of @"/object?sortBy=name", or @"/object?sortBy=name&amp;color=red"

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new dictionary of query parameters, with keys like 'sortBy' and value arrays (if requested) like ['name'].

Token.Abstract: Returns a URL encoded representation of self.
